title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 4. Regulation 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the insertion
text_raw:
4. Regulation 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the insertion 

of the following definitions: 

“‘Act of 1927’ means the Intoxicating Liquor Act 1927 (No. 15 of 
1927); 

‘relevant entertainment premises’ means a premises - 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th October, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [536] 3 

(a) where 

the business or service of a nightclub or 
discotheque (including those licensed under the Public 
Dance Halls Act 1935 (No. 2 of 1935)) is carried on or 
otherwise provided, or 

(b) 

a premises - 

(i) 

at which a live performance takes place, 

(ii) 

at which there is, on the date that the Health Act 
1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) 
(Covid-19) 
(No. 18) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 536 of 2021) come into 
operation - 

(Amendment) 

(No. 2) 

(I) 

a designated performance area, stage or booth 
for performers, and 

(II) a designated dance floor, standing area or 
seating area used exclusively for the purposes 
of viewing the area, stage or booth referred to 
in clause (I), and 

(iii) 

in relation to which one or more of the following has 
been granted: 

(I) 

an on-licence (within the meaning of the 
Public Health (Alcohol) Act 2018 (No. 24 of 
2018)); 

(II) a theatre licence (within the meaning of 

section 1 of the Act of 1927); 

(III) a special exemption order (within the meaning 

of section 5 of the Act of 1927); 

(IV) a public dancing licence (within the meaning 
of section 2 of the Public Dance Halls Act 
1935); 

(V) a public music and singing licence (within the 
meaning of Part IV of the Public Health Acts 
Amendment Act 1890); 

(VI) an occasional licence (within the meaning of 

section 6 of Act of 1927);”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 5. Regulation 13 of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
5. Regulation 13 of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) 

in paragraph (1), by 
subparagraph for subparagraph (b): 

the substitution of 

the following 

“(b) Without prejudice to the generality of Regulation 12, and 
except to the extent to which it is lawful for an indoor 
operator to permit or otherwise grant access to a premises 
in accordance with section 31AB of the Act of 1947, or in 

 
 
 4 [536] 

accordance with any regulations made under that section, 
a specified person shall ensure that - 

(i) members of the public are not permitted, or 
otherwise granted, access to a part of a relevant 
premises that is indoors, or permitted to remain in an 
indoor part of such premises, other than for as long 
as is strictly required for the purposes of - 

(I) 

accessing an indoor toilet facility, 

(II) ordering or collecting, or both, food or 
beverages for consumption off such premises, 

(III) paying for goods sold or services provided, or 

both, at the premises, 

(IV) accessing an outdoor seating area or smoking 

area, or 

(V) accessing, for unavoidable reasons of an 
emergency nature, indoor parts of the premises 
to protect a person’s health or welfare, and 

(ii) persons are not permitted to purchase or otherwise 
acquire intoxicating liquor for consumption - 

(I) 

on a relevant premises (other than a relevant 
entertainment premises) unless the intoxicating 
liquor is consumed by that person whilst such 
person is seated at an outdoor table, or 

(II) on a relevant accommodation premises (other 
than a relevant entertainment premises), unless 
the intoxicating liquor is consumed by a 
relevant guest whilst such guest is seated at a 
table.”, 

(b) by the deletion of subparagraph (c) of paragraph (1), 

(c) 

in paragraph (2), by the substitution of “A specified person 
shall, in relation to a relevant premises (other than a relevant 
entertainment premises)” for “A specified person shall, in 
relation to a relevant premises”, 

(d) 

in paragraph (2A), by the substitution of “paragraph (2) or (2B), 
as the case may be,” for “paragraph (2)”, 

(e) 

by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (2A): 

 “(2B) A specified person shall, in relation to a relevant 
entertainment premises, in the case of each person permitted, or 
otherwise granted, access to the premises (other than persons so 
accessing in a professional capacity, in the course of their 
employment or in fulfilment of a contract for services), make a 
record (using ticketing information or otherwise) of the person’s 
name and telephone number.”, 

(f) 

in paragraph (5) - 

 
 [536] 5 

(i) 

(ii) 

in subparagraph (a), by the deletion of “, during the 
specified period”, and 

in subparagraph (b), by the deletion of the definition of 
“specified period”, and 

(g) 

in paragraph (8), by the deletion of the definition of “relevant 
period”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 6. The Principal Regulations are amended, in paragraph 1 of Schedule 2,
text_raw:
6. The Principal Regulations are amended, in paragraph 1 of Schedule 2, 
by the substitution of “relevant entertainment premises” for “Nightclubs and 
discotheques, including those licenced under the Public Dance Halls Act 1935 
(No. 2 of 1935)”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 October, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [536]

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) (Covid19) (No.2) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 217 of 2021) are amended to remove restrictions on 
opening hours for certain relevant premises and specified premises and to 
provide for consequential amendments in order to bring relevant entertainment 
premises within the scope of Regulations made under section 31AB of the 
Health (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 2021. These regulations shall remain in 
operation up to the 9th November 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [536] 7
